messages.content: You are Punie, an AI coding assistant for Python projects. You help developers write, test, and maintain Python code using available tools.
Find TestHelper across the project and list its file symbols

<tool_call><function=execute_code>
<parameter=code>
# Step 1: Search workspace for the symbol
ws_result = workspace_symbols("TestHelper")
if ws_result.success and ws_result.symbols:
    first = ws_result.symbols[0]
    print(f"Found {first.name} in {first.file}:{first.line}")

    # Step 2: List all symbols in that file
    doc_result = document_symbols(first.file)
    if doc_result.success:
        print(f"\nSymbols in {first.file} ({doc_result.symbol_count} total):")
        for sym in doc_result.symbols:
            print(f"  {sym.kind} {sym.name} line {sym.line}")
    else:
        print("Could not list symbols")
else:
    print("Symbol not found in workspace")
</parameter>
</function></tool_call>
You are Punie, an AI coding assistant for Python projects. You help developers write, test, and maintain Python code using available tools.
Check code quality: lint, types, and tests

<tool_call><function=execute_code>
<parameter=code>
# Run full quality pipeline
ruff_result = ruff_check("src")
print(f"Ruff: {ruff_result.violation_count} violations")

ty_result = typecheck("src")
print(f"Types: {ty_result.error_count} errors")

test_result = pytest_run("tests")
print(f"Tests: {test_result.passed} passed, {test_result.failed} failed")

all_ok = ruff_result.success and ty_result.success and test_result.success
status = "PASS" if all_ok else "FAIL"
print(f"\nOverall: {status}")
</parameter>
</function></tool_call>

You are Punie, an AI coding assistant for Python projects. You help developers write, test, and maintain Python code using available tools.
Find modified files and read the most recently changed

<tool_call><function=execute_code>
<parameter=code>
# Step 1: Check git status
status = git_status(".")
if not status.clean:
    print(f"{status.file_count} files changed:")
    for f in status.files:
        print(f"  {f.file} ({f.status})")

    # Step 2: Read the first modified file
    first_file = status.files[0].file
    content = read_file(first_file)
    lines = content.split("\n")
    print(f"\n--- {first_file} ({len(lines)} lines) ---")
    for line in lines[:20]:
        print(line)
else:
    print("Working tree clean, no files to read")
</parameter>
</function></tool_call>
You are Punie, an AI coding assistant for Python projects. You help developers write, test, and maintain Python code using available tools.
What symbols are defined in src/config.py?

<tool_call><function=execute_code>
<parameter=code>
result = document_symbols("src/config.py")
if result.success:
    print(f"{result.symbol_count} symbols in src/config.py:")
    for sym in result.symbols:
        print(f"  {sym.kind} {sym.name} (line {sym.line})")
else:
    print("Could not list symbols")
</parameter>
</function></tool_call>

You are Punie, an AI coding assistant for Python projects. You help developers write, test, and maintain Python code using available tools.
Run ruff, ty, and pytest together on src/

<tool_call><function=execute_code>
<parameter=code>
# Run full quality pipeline
ruff_result = ruff_check("src")
print(f"Ruff: {ruff_result.violation_count} violations")

ty_result = typecheck("src")
print(f"Types: {ty_result.error_count} errors")

test_result = pytest_run("tests")
print(f"Tests: {test_result.passed} passed, {test_result.failed} failed")

all_ok = ruff_result.success and ty_result.success and test_result.success
status = "PASS" if all_ok else "FAIL"
print(f"\nOverall: {status}")
</parameter>
</function></tool_call>
